item.title: Support frame broken on New tree, 30th June
item.description:
The support frame on this newish tree is broken (post either rotted away or broken at base) . This has caused the tree to lean over and could in a strong wind brake like the previous tree did . Could this be rectified please.

item.title: Problem with drains - Owen Road, 30th June
item.description:
A group that congregates in Owen Road have put a large number of car registration plates in all the drains in Owen Road and in the drain outside no 69 Mitchell Road. A few months ago the police did pick up plates from the drains but these need to be collected again and handed to the police
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Owen Road, Bowes, London

item.title: Paddling pool neglected and broken for years with no action, 30th June
item.description:
The paddling pool in the croydon recreation grounds has been broken and neglected for years. In the last ten years it had an inch of water several times, obviously neglected and dilapidated with concrete structure deteriorating and tiles falling off. There has been no checks, no refurbishment, no maintenance, or even no simple power washing of the paddling pool. Last summer it was totally broken and had no water. But the management ( whoever is responsible) waited till June 2025 to "discover" that it is in fact broken. Why there were no checks and maintenance done last year, or this winter ? Or years and years prior when it was allowed to go beyond the point of no return? The upkeep of playgrounds and parks in Bromley is below basic minimum level.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The paving between the scaffolding and the building, outside the entrance to the building., 30th June
item.description:
On 7th June 2025 at approx 08:35, I was running towards the 46 bus stop on Royal College Street towards Camden Road. My foot landed between different levels of height in the pavement and I fell. The pavement has a dip outside the entrance of the building which cannot be seen from the end of Royal College Street. The scaffolding reduces visibility, even though lighting is provided, I found it impossible to notice the difference when the height of the pavement drops. I went to the hospital the next morning where the x-rays confirmed fractures in several bones in my foot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crowndale Road, Saint Pancras, London
Report on FixMyStreet
